TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCSprite extends MonoTouch.Cocos2D.CCNode

summary.para: is a 2d image ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_(computer_graphics) )

remarks.para: is a 2d image ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_(computer_graphics) )
can be created with an image, or with a sub-rectangle of an image.

If the parent or any of its ancestors is a then the following features/limitations are valid
Features when the parent is a CCBatchNode:MUCH faster rendering, specially if the CCSpriteBatchNode has many children. All the children will be drawn in a single batch.

item.description: LimitationsCamera is not supported yet (eg: CCOrbitCamera action doesn't work)GridBase actions are not supported (eg: CCLens, CCRipple, CCTwirl)The Alias/Antialias property belongs to CCSpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the aliased property.The Blending function property belongs to CCSpriteBatchNode, so you can't individually set the blending function property.Parallax scroller is not supported, but can be simulated with a "proxy" sprite.

remarks.para:
If the parent is an standard , then behaves like any other :
It supports blending functions
It supports aliasing / antialiasing
But the rendering will be slower: 1 draw per children.
The default anchorPoint in is (0.5, 0.5).

public virtual bool FlipX { get; set; }
.property instance bool FlipX

summary.para: whether or not the sprite is flipped horizontally. It only flips the texture of the sprite, and not the texture of the sprite's children. Also, flipping the texture doesn't alter the anchorPoint. If you want to flip the anchorPoint too, and/or to flip the children too use: sprite.scaleX *= -1;

remarks.para: whether or not the sprite is flipped horizontally. It only flips the texture of the sprite, and not the texture of the sprite's children. Also, flipping the texture doesn't alter the anchorPoint. If you want to flip the anchorPoint too, and/or to flip the children too use: sprite.scaleX *= -1;

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool FlipY { get; set; }
.property instance bool FlipY

summary.para: whether or not the sprite is flipped vertically. It only flips the texture of the sprite, and not the texture of the sprite's children. Also, flipping the texture doesn't alter the anchorPoint. If you want to flip the anchorPoint too, and/or to flip the children too use: sprite.scaleY *= -1;

remarks.para: whether or not the sprite is flipped vertically. It only flips the texture of the sprite, and not the texture of the sprite's children. Also, flipping the texture doesn't alter the anchorPoint. If you want to flip the anchorPoint too, and/or to flip the children too use: sprite.scaleY *= -1;

summary.para:
Initializes an sprite with a CGImageRef and a key The key is used by the to know if a texture was already created with this CGImage. For example, a valid key is: "sprite_frame_01". If key is nil, then a new texture will be created each time by the .
v0.99.0

summary.para: set the vertex rect. It will be called internally by setTextureRect. Useful if you want to create 2x images from SD images in Retina Display. Do not call it manually. Use setTextureRect instead.
